/tasks2 shows no open tasks but shows epics
data.approach: Investigate why /tasks2 OPEN TASKS section shows "No open tasks" message but displays many epics below. The issue appears to be a UI/logic disconnect where epics are being shown as expandable headers but non-epic tasks are not being displayed. Will trace through getTasksByEpic and tasksByProject logic.

data.taskTitle: /tasks2 > squad > opentasks shows no open tasks but then shows many epics
summary: Fixed confusing UI: No open tasks message appearing above epic groups
Root cause: Standalone tasks group rendered even when empty
Fix: Added condition to only render standalone group when epicTasks.length > 0

data.taskTitle: /tasks2 > squad > opentasks shows no open tasks but then shows many epics
summary: Root cause: getTasksByEpic was including non-open tasks (in_progress, blocked, closed)
TasksOpen then filtered for status=open, finding none, showing No open tasks
Fix 1: Added status === open filter to getTasksByEpic function
Fix 2: Changed section condition from projectTasks.length to tasksByEpic.size
Fix 3: Updated getProjectTaskCount to only count open non-epic tasks
Fix 4: Epic groups now only show when they have open children
Added TaskIdBadge to epic headers for consistent badge styling
Changed epic title fallback to Untitled Epic instead of showing raw ID
Added epicTasks.length/epicSessions.length > 0 check before rendering TasksOpen/TasksActive
Updated count display to show X open or X active
Fixed standalone sessions to only render when there are sessions
Investigated discrepancy in /tasks2 view between open tasks and epic display
Identified potential rendering or data retrieval issue in tasks view
Examined task listing logic to understand epic vs open task representation
